Lump removal and investigation)? Assuming one is covered for private hospitalisation. One factor of concern if going for private is the post hospitalization expenses that may turn out to be substantial if the condition requires follow up and it exceeds the coverage period. Luke Ho, Money Maverick at Money MaverickLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 08 Apr 2019Always assume private is better. If you've already got the appropriate insurance that covers a private hospital, just GO according to your coverage. If your post-hosp coverage isn't long enough, get a new one!
